channel.title: Paying 20 dollars for help with portal [pi]

item.title: Paying 20 dollars for help with portal [pi]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Encryption, post:8, topic:403115”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=500176.msg3658008#msg3658008 date=1310160952]

case ####:
    if (!player.getInventory().isEmpty() || !player.getEquipment().isEmpty()) {
        final MessagePacket packet = new MessagePacket(
            "You must empty your inventory and equipment before entering.");
        player.getClient().sendPacket(packet);
        break;
    }
    player.setLocation(x, y, z);
    break;

Pseudo-code, etc.
[/quote]

Getting your items auto banked is easier ;)[/quote]

What if when they entered they weren’t near a bank? Then when they get teleported back to where they were (which should be done), they have to walk to the nearest bank (which, depending on where you are, can be quite a distance).

Or I suppose you could just store the items temporarily, depending on the scenario.

Read full topic
item.source: Paying 20 dollars for help with portal [pi]

Pseudo-code, etc.[/quote]

Getting your items auto banked is easier

item.title: Paying 20 dollars for help with portal [pi]
item.dc:creator: @Encryption Encryption
item.description:
@Encryption wrote:

case 2477: for (int j = 0; j < c.playerEquipment.length; j++) { if (c.playerEquipment[j] > 0) { c.sendMessage("Please remove all your equipment before teleporting to dungeoneering."); return; } } for(int itemID = 0; itemID < 101; itemID++) { for(int invSlot = 0; invSlot < 28; invSlot++) { c.getItems().bankItem(itemID, invSlot, 2147000000); } } c.getPA().startTeleport(3032, 5189, 0, "modern"); c.getPA().closeAllWindows(); c.sendMessage("Items in your inventory have been banked."); c.sendMessage("You are now in Duneoneering, it is under construction so save your points."); c.playerLevel[5] = 0; c.prayerId = -1; c.getItems().addItem(4587, 1); c.getItems().addItem(5698, 1); c.getItems().addItem(139, 2); c.getItems().addItem(861, 1); c.getItems().addItem(892, 1000); c.getItems().addItem(391, 23); c.getPA().refreshSkill(5); break;

Make sure it’s somewhere under this void.

public void firstClickObject(int objectType, int obX, int obY) { c.clickObjectType = 0; //c.sendMessage("Object type: " + objectType); c.handleObject(objectType); if (c.agilityEmote) return; if (objectType >= 1530 && objectType <= 1535 || objectType >= 16776 && objectType <= 16778 || objectType == 14306) {//door new Object(-1, obX, obY, c.heightLevel, 0, 0, objectType, 1); return; } if (objectType == 6100) { new Object(c.objectId, obX, obY, c.heightLevel, 1, 0, objectType, 1); return; } switch(objectType) {

I’d like 20 dollars though, but you cried and I felt bad.

I thought of this code all by myself, even though it’s still incomplete in some ways.

Read full topic

item.description:
@k1ng0frs wrote:

this was release in the snippet list i got the code for you.

case ####(object): for(int r=0; r<c.playerEquipment.length; r++) { int item = c.playerEquipment[r]; if((item > 0) && (item < 19999)) { c.sendMessage("Please remove all armor and weapons before entering!"); return; } else { c.getPA().startTeleport2(####, ####, #); } } break;
this is not mines but credit to the guy who made it

item.title: Paying 20 dollars for help with portal [pi]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Mr Firecape, post:1, topic:403115”]Hello i am paying 20 dollars for help!
This is so hard no one had been able to figure it out i need to make it so that no one can take ANY ITEMS in there inventory or equipped
here is the code for you to work with it
case 2477://portal 10
c.getPA().startTeleport(3113, 3348, 0, “modern”);
c.getItems().addItem(4587, 1);
c.getItems().addItem(5698, 1);
c.getItems().addItem(139, 2);
c.getItems().addItem(861, 1);
c.getItems().addItem(892, 1000);
c.getItems().addItem(391, 23);
c.sendMessage(“Goodluck!”);
break;

also paste you’re paypal and idc if you’re not allowed to pay people are putting time and effort into this.[/quote]

Help is free.

Also, you’re not even trying.

Read full topic
